title: How Many Calories in a Gin and Tonic?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in a gin tonic, including carbs from tonic, alcohol content, and tweaks like diet versions for lower calories.
h1: How Many Calories in a Gin and Tonic?
assumptions: Standard serving: 1.5 oz (44 ml) gin, 6 oz (177 ml) tonic water; no garnishes or added sugar.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by gin brand, tonic type, pour sizes, and mixers. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard gin and tonic contains about 180 kcal, primarily from the tonic's sugars and gin's alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use diet tonic water instead of regular
Add a splash of lime juice (1 oz)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a gin and tonic with diet tonic?
faqs.a: About 60 kcal, as diet tonic has zero sugar.

faqs.q: Where do the calories in a gin tonic come from?
faqs.a: Mostly from tonic sugars (~120 kcal) and gin alcohol (~60 kcal).

faqs.q: Is a gin and tonic low-carb?
faqs.a: Regular version has ~15 g carbs from tonic; diet tonic makes it near zero.

faqs.q: How does tonic water affect calories in gin tonic?
faqs.a: Regular tonic adds ~120 kcal from sugars; it's the main calorie source.

faqs.q: What if I use soda water instead of tonic?
faqs.a: Swapping tonic for soda water drops calories to ~60 kcal from gin alone.
